intro: Crepis amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that clasp the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a single head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Crepis amplexicaulis is an annual or biennial plant with a short life cycle and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
